locate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to find the exact position of something
locate.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We couldnâ€™t locate the source of the radio signal.
locate.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to put or build something in a particular place
locate.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Large retail chains are usually only prepared to locate stores in areas of high population density.
locate.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to come to a place and start a business, company etc there
locate.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We are offering incentives for companies to locate in our city.
locate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to start a business or company in a particular place
locate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Foreign companies began to locate new plants in the United States.
A growing number of small factories are finding it pays to locate in cities.
locate.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to be based in a particular place
locate.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The offices are located in Portland, Oregon.
